lines.text: Have you ever been wrong?
I thought so once, but I was wrong.
I can't believe you have these mortals convinced that you're this "Kevin Sorbo" character.
Some people just aren't ready for the truth.
Ah, my fame spread like wildfire.
No, more like a bad rash.
All men think they're fascinating- in my case, it's justified.
What are you doing here?
What do you mean?
Iolaus, you're dead.
Yeah, well, I was kinda hoping you wouldn't notice.
[Hercules is walking through a cavern where dozens of Arachne's cocooned victims are bound in spider's web]
This is one big web site.
Gadzooks, if I were a woman I'd kiss myself!
The truth hurts doesn't it.
Yeah, so does my fist.
Rage makes a poor tactician.
[Iolaus tries to fight a giant eel by himself]
How do you expect to win?
You just keep going until something clever occurs to you.

[poking a spear at a trembling bush]
Come out, spy!

[standing up indignantly]
I'm not a spy! I'm a slave!
We do not accept slaves in Troy.
That's all right. I'm used to prejudice.
Once you have harpies you can't get rid of them.
I hate to break it to you, big guy, you've got harpies.
This is not my world... DISAPPOINTED!
Of course I care about the needs of the people... I happen to be one of them.
Rumor has it that Otis stole it from a warlord who had stolen it from someone else.
So much for honor among thieves; gives us all a bad name.
[after bopping a thug in the face with his own forehead]
Ahh! How do people do that without getting headaches?
